text: Basti Abdullah railway station () is located in town of Basti-Abdullah, Rajanpur district in province of Punjab, Pakistan. ==History== The Raily Station Was Built Around 1980s By The Pakistani Government And Is Named After Lal Masjid's Founder Maulana Abdullah Ghazi ==See also== * List of railway stations in Pakistan * Pakistan Railways ==References== ==External links== *Official Web Site of Pakistan Railways Category:Railway stations in Rajanpur District
title: Basti Abdullah railway station
